result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcella A. Finch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Sample.
Completion of AODA and follow through with treatment discretion of agent.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
Counseling as deemed beneficial by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcella A. Finch

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:16 AM Defendant Marcella A. Finch in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Marcella A. Finch. State gives plea agreement, plea to both ct's, waiver of p.h. needs to be completed, ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, DNA surcharge and sample, AODA and follow th Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for or 100 hours community service is disability or retired, counseling, ct 2 time served costs and DNA surcharge.  Atty Zich and def. agree to plea agreement. Waiver of preliminary examination filed and gone over with def.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Information filed electronically. Atty Zich has copy of information, waives reading and request to continue with plea/sentencing.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed and gone over with def.  Def. understands charges and penalties. Ct 1 Poss of Meth, repeater, Guilty plea, & Ct 2 Poss of Drug Paraph, repeater, Guilty plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def.  understands elements.  Def. admits prior conviction. Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.   Atty Zich is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis. Court finds factual basis, accept pleas and finds def. Guilty to Ct 1 Poss of Meth, repeater & Ct 2 Poss of Drug Paraph, repeater. Sate gives sentencing remarks and ask court to adopt joint recommendation. Atty Zich gives sentencing remarks and ask to adopt joint recommendation. Def. makes statement. Court gives sentencing factors & orders on ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, $250 DNA surcharge and sample, Completion of AODA and follow through with treatment discretion of agent, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, 100 hours community service, & counseling as deemed beneficial by agent, ct 2 time served costs and  $200DNA surcharge, 40 days sentence, with 40 days credit, time served. Def. given pp. Def. questions $30 amount on p.p. Court orders 50 a month. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

2:15 PM Defendant Marcella A. Finch appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Marcella A. Finch. Attorneys appear via zoom. Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights & request timely p.h. Atty Zich heard on bond modification filed by def. CC will hear bail bond modification @ PH date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:25 PM Defendant Marcella A. Finch appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  All parties via zoom. Court reviews history of case. Def. made contact with PD.  Def. heard on bail/bond modification.  State makes statement. Def. is on probation hold.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances

3:58 PM Defendant Marcella A. Finch appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State gives bail/bond recommendations. Def. is on a probation hold. Def. makes statement. Court orders $2500 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety, & No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. makes statement.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
